Did anyone see the legislation that is being proposed by Ilhan Omar? 

https://omar.house.gov/sites/omar.house.gov/files/Omar%20-%20Rent%20%26%20Mortgage%20Cancellation%20Act%20-One%20Pager%20and%20Legislative%20Framework.pdf


The penalties section is listed as follows:

 c. Penalties ‚Äì Any property owner or mortgagee that takes adverse action against any tenant or owner of real property for exercising their rights under this Act, shall be subject to a judgment for actual damages as well as the following penalties:

i. First Violation: $5000 civil penalty or fine.

ii. Second Violation: $10,000 civil penalty or fine.

iii. Third and Subsequent Violations: $50,000 civil penalty or fine, or forfeiture of property.

d. In any civil action brought under this Act, the court may award preventative relief, including a permanent or temporary injunction or other order, to ensure the full rights granted by this Act.

e. In a civil action brought under this Act, the court shall award any prevailing plaintiff, other than the United States, a reasonable attorney‚Äôs fee and costs


She‚Äôs advocating for the GOVERNMENT SEIZURE of Personal Property.

The city should prepare themselves for a civil suit. 

Property rights are one of the largest sources of revenue for city/county/state. 

If I‚Äôm a resident of Washington and my tenants are inspired to do the same, I would have already filed a suit for damages. 

She‚Äôs a liability to the city.

You can develop rental prospects in a number of different ways. Facebook ads etc. Post an Ad with your contact info/phone number.

I generally talk to them on the phone, get an idea of what they‚Äôre looking for, area/rooms etc. While talking to them I layout the deposit amount, rental terms and application process requirements: Credit/Background Check/Income Verification-Pay Stubs.

Once I screen a prospect, I then show them the unit in person. If they want to proceed, I get their email. 

Once I have their email I set it up on the landlord MySmartMove.com website. Once you sign up, all you need to do is setup the property and enter their email in the app box. It sends them the application, it generally costs them about $45. If they decide to argue about the cost of a $45 application then there‚Äôs no way they can afford to pay rent. 

It runs a background and credit check. Also get pay stubs electronically. From there you can decide. 

I generally require a full months rent as deposit and the first months rent BEFORE moving in. Again, if they can‚Äôt afford this then they generally can‚Äôt afford the rent. 

I send an electronic invoice every month, due on the first & late on the 6th. I charge a late fee after this. 

Be firm, this is your property, your asset. It‚Äôs not a charity, don‚Äôt let prospective tenants give you sob stories about their life/bad credit/etc. 

It is what it is. Volatility in behavior is a bad thing, be consistent about your expectations and don‚Äôt waiver.

What you are describing is hearsay. 

The report of another person's words by a witness is usually disallowed as evidence in a court of law.

>No contract and she'll win a dispute and if she has any damages from a false collection report she can sue and win.

A judgement in small claims court (which costs about $300) will hold up to any disputes. 

>She'll be the one winning legal fees if OP takes your advice.

Again, it would be very easy to demonstrate financial loss in small claims court (especially if she's a tenant like you say).

>Better to do though a lawyer. Do it wrong and she'll be winning in court.

Yes, like I stated, an Unlawful Detainer will reconcile the whole issue.

>You don't seem to understand the law and how it protects tenants from people like you.

The law protects both tenant and landlord, particularly from individuals illegally occupying a property.

>You sound like one.

You sound like someone who has been evicted for failure to pay rent.

>Likely she's a tenant.

Likely doesn't hold up in a court of law.

>Her boyfriend moved her in, she's likely a tenant. So she has lawful permission until a judge evicts her

Hearsay is not legal basis, the report of another person's words by a witness is usually disallowed as evidence in a court of law.
What is your basis for this statement?

You must specialize in non-profit. 

It costs a few hundred dollars to turn this over to a collection agency. Regardless of collection, it will go on her credit. 

It‚Äôs very easy to demonstrate responsibility for legal fees and lost rent. 

This can be easily explained to her in person. If she refuses to move then file a civil suit for the cost of legal fees and lost rent. If she doesn‚Äôt respond then file the unlawful detainer. 

Like most people these days, you don‚Äôt seem to understand the importance of property right.

I‚Äôm not the slumlord, she‚Äôs a squatter. She doesn‚Äôt have lawful permission to occupy the property.

She doesn‚Äôt meet the legal definition of tenant. Under your interpretation, anyone off the street could say they had a verbal agreement with the tenant and be subject to living in the property. 

What you are discussing is interpretation of law.

Any lawyer worth his salt knows how to do case research. A lawyer can easily obtain similar cases in which a precedent was set in defining ‚Äútenant‚Äù in the state of Wisconsin. 

You could easily type up a letter (or pay a lawyer to do one for $500) discussing the repercussions of her refusing to vacate the property, specifically financial liability (cost of legal fees, lost rent etc). 

She need not be a party to the lease agreement to be financially responsible for damages made against the owner/landlord. This would be easy to demonstrate in a court of law. 

This whole situation could be determined in small claims court for a cost of about $300. If the tenant refuses to show, end of conversation.

Do you understand how statistical sampling works? This is very different from a Fox News poll.
The state has been in a downward trend since 1819.

There‚Äôs some evidence that the virus was circulating in the U.S. much earlier (and more widespread) than previously thought.

Either it‚Äôs not as contagious as previously indicated or the death rate is much lower. 

The only way to know where we truly stand is to conduct statistical sampling in a number of locations throughout the country to determine what percentage of Americans actually have Covid-19 antibodies.

At this point we have a plethora of statistical noise. For a nation that has more intellectual resources than any country on earth, the lack of response has been remarkable.

‚ÄúShould have planned and saved money in case of emergencies......‚Äù

In a perfect world where the economy is never volatile and expenses are small and predictable, that could work. 

Unfortunately, the real world is chaos (such as the case with a pandemic). 

Many businesses (like restaurants) operate on very slim margins. To imply that (savings) is the answer shows a true lack of financial experience. Not to mention that it screams of financial privilege. 

What would your advice have been to the millions of Americans tossed on the streets during the Great Recession? Savings? 

No one is favoring landlords, I‚Äôm simply stating that they‚Äôre being pressed like everyone else (especially from the banks).

If anyone needs to be held accountable its the banks who take trillions in bailouts (taxpayer money) then turn around and toss Americans on the street.

You do realize that landlords have property taxes, income taxes, insurance, mortgage payments and maintenance expenses that are also due. Despite how shitty it is, those bills are still due. 

Who do you expect to come repair your HVAC or flooded toilet if it were to go out? You‚Äôre not the only one that‚Äôs getting screwed here. It‚Äôs life, it sucks, we all know. Everyone is suffering at the moment.

Woodfin gave masks to the Birmingham police department at a time when nurses and doctors desperately need these supplies in order to fight the pandemic.

As you have said, you can do all the employment, metro demographics, crime type searches you want but still not know. 

I would say Birmingham is relatively safe, most of the crime is confined to particular areas of town. This is no different than areas in the northeast or out west. 

Birmingham has an enormous medical community. It touches almost every part of the city. Many people are employed in this sector, UAB etc. 

UAB (University of Alabama-Birmingham) sprawls across the entire city. A school of about 22k students. 

In terms of $900 per month, you can definitely live in a safe area for this price. I work in real estate, feel free to message me if you want a few recommendations for Apartments etc. I would look between Hwy 280 and downtown (near highland ave etc). 

Hwy 280 has some beautiful areas, the parks near highland and downtown are beautiful as well. Everything is really green. 

The weather is significantly better than in Iowa or Maine. You won‚Äôt have to shovel snow every winter as we have maybe 12 weeks or so of mild winter. 

The city is liberal the suburbs are conservative (like most places). 

Birmingham is full of great places to eat. The city is littered with restaurants and breweries. I‚Äôm sure others could give you a much more in-depth analysis of this. 

The city is about 4 & 1/2 hours from the Gulf of Mexico, which many people here visit during the spring/summer/fall. 

As a bonus, football in Alabama is unlike anything you‚Äôve ever seen. It makes life much more interesting. The city is 50 miles northeast of Tuscaloosa (University of Alabama), which is a great college town. I encourage anyone visiting to attended a college football game there.

I‚Äôm trying to keep some anonymity here. 

It‚Äôs in Alabama (1970s) if you want to sleuth.

You can just walk-in and tell them you would like to speak with someone in sales tax. 

No appointment necessary. Feel free to let me know how that goes.

I would go to see the state office first (Hoover Public Safety Center/2nd floor). Tell them what you‚Äôre doing, I know they have a simplified version now where you can file and remit all your taxes through their system. They usually take you in a small conference room and show you how to do it on a computer. 

If the person you‚Äôre speaking with isn‚Äôt helpful, ask the front desk for someone else. 

I say go to the state office first because they developed and operate all the software to file your taxes online, in one place. The local (county/city) offices are somewhat less helpful because they have less resources. 

Whatever you do, don‚Äôt call a company called RDS for advice. They‚Äôre a private company that some localities hire to administer taxes (they don‚Äôt have a clue). 

If you have any follow up questions, feel free to ask. I used to work with the state on similar issues.

Not me but my folks. My dad used to have parties at his apartment in the late 1970s, him and my mother lived together. 

Often times, random people would show up at the party that they did not know (maybe 30-40 people around the place, normal at the time). There was this one guy that had reappeared several times over the course of a month. 

One night, my mother‚Äôs two friends asked her to go have a drink a few blocks away, she said she was tired and stayed in with my dad that evening (her boyfriend at the time). 

Later that night (maybe 2-3 in the morning) my father awoke to see that random guy sitting in a car parked out in front of their apartment. 

Long story short, my mother‚Äôs friends went to get a drink earlier in the night. As they were walking in, the same random guy pulled up next to them in the bar parking lot and asked them for a light. 

He forced them both into his car, tied them up, drove them to a rural county north of the city; raped them, mutilated them and beat them both to death (or so he thought). A few days later, hunters in the area found one of them and called police/ambulance. She lived, my moms other friend died. 

After the guy did this, he then drove to my parents apartment and sat in the parking lot in front of their place (they speculated he was looking for my mother). 

The police were able to identify him, he was sitting at the table eating dinner with his mother when the police arrived at her home to arrest him. 

Turns out, he had kidnapped and murdered a small handful of women in the area. He‚Äôs still alive, in prison. Lifetime made a movie about it.

This is overly complex, if she‚Äôs a sole-proprietor almost none of this is necessary except for a business license and sales tax filing. 

Particularly a FEIN number (federal tax number), sole proprietors simply use their Social Security number. 

Also, filing as an LLC will require you to file and report quarterly income taxes (the cost of filing usually outweighs the income generated by a small online business). 

Alabama (as do most other states now) have particular laws relating to online sales tax, see Amazon.

To keep it simple, there‚Äôs 3 type of government taxes for sales tax: State, County and City. 

Here is a FAQ section on the State website. 

https://revenue.alabama.gov/sales-use/faq/

If you have any questions, simply call your local taxpayer service center (for Bham they‚Äôre at the Hoover Public Safety Center). 

They should be able to tell you what local you should be charging taxes for. 

In terms of Use tax, if you pay tax on your materials at purchase there‚Äôs no reason to pay use tax. 

Small online businesses can sometimes file a one time sales tax return per year if sales are minimal.

If it goes out of state (shipped out of state) you don‚Äôt collect.

All of these can be filed online, it‚Äôs very simple.

There‚Äôs just a gap in him. You can‚Äôt penetrate him, you can‚Äôt get close to him, he‚Äôs a steel wall.
